CSSFilter-functionOpacity.summary: The opacity() CSS function applies transparency to the samples in the input image. Its result is a {{cssxref("<filter-function>")}}.

blockquote.para: Note: This function is similar to the more established opacity property. The difference is that with filters, some browsers provide hardware acceleration for better performance.

remarks.para:
-The other {{cssxref("<filter-function>")}} functions available to be used in values of the filter and backdrop-filter properties include:-filter-function/blur
-filter-function/brightness
-filter-function/contrast
-filter-function/drop-shadow
-filter-function/grayscale
-filter-function/hue-rotate
-filter-function/invert
-filter-function/saturate
-filter-function/sepia
-The CSS opacity property
